ground_truth: The scene starts with a spider that lands on a desk and then on a boy's head before crawling up a girl's arm. Moody flicks his wand, making the spider hover over Ron, and then it drops into Ron's hair. The spider clamps itself on Draco's face and hits the glass. Controlled by Moody's wand, the spider hovers helplessly over a bucket of water before Moody directs it to the palm of his hand. Neville puts up his hand and steps towards the table as the spider writhes in agony. Neville looks distraught, with his face twisted in anger. Hermione cries out, and Moody lowers his wand, withdrawing the curse. Neville's eyes are tight shut, and his face is clammy. Moody places the spider in front of Hermione, who shakes her head. A flash of green light occurs, and the spider dies. Moody's mad eye swivels to stare at Harry, who looks up warily. Moody nervously licks his lips and takes a swig from his hip flask, while Harry regards him thoughtfully. Leaving the classroom, Ron follows Hermione and Harry down a circular stone staircase, and Moody appears as they spot a sad figure. Neville reluctantly follows Moody back up the stairs. Rain runs like tears down the face of a woman in a stained-glass window, and students splash across the courtyard with cloaks over their heads to protect themselves from the rain. The goblet of fire stands in the great hall, and eligible students cross the circle of light around it, placing their names into the blue flame. Cedric Diggory's supporters push him forward, and he steps through the circle to put his name into the goblet, while Ron gives him an encouraging wave. Fred and George run into the hall in triumph, swallow the contents of a test tube, and jump inside the circle to put their names into the goblet but are engulfed in blue flames and flung out of the circle with white hair and long, white beards. They grapple with each other, rolling over on the stone floor. Hermione shakes her head, sits on the stone steps, and opens a book. Accompanied by a Durmstrang student and their teacher, Karkaroff, Viktor Krum approaches the circle confidently, with a serious look, and puts his name into the goblet, catching Hermione's eye as he turns away. She gives him a faint, admiring smile. The students assemble excitedly in the great hall as Dumbledore raises his hand, causing the flames of the burning torches around the hall to gradually die down one by one, and everyone looks expectant. Dumbledore approaches the goblet of fire with his arm outstretched as the blue flame turns red, and a piece of charred parchment flutters down into his hand.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The tableau commences with a arachnid that descends on a table and then on a lad's head before scuttling up a lass's limb. Moody flicks his staff, causing the arachnid to levitate above Ron, and then it descends into Ron's hair. The arachnid clamps itself on Draco's visage and strikes the glass. Controlled by Moody's staff, the arachnid levitates impotently over a pail of liquid before Moody guides it to the palm of his hand. Neville raises his hand and steps towards the platform as the arachnid writhes in torment. Neville appears distraught, with his visage twisted in fury. Hermione cries aloud, and Moody lowers his staff, withdrawing the curse. Neville's eyes are tightly shut, and his visage is clammy. Moody places the arachnid in front of Hermione, who shakes her head. A flash of emerald radiance transpires, and the arachnid perishes. Moody's deranged eye swivels to gaze at Harry, who looks up cautiously. Moody anxiously moistens his lips and takes a swig from his hip flask, while Harry regards him pensively. Leaving the classroom, Ron trails Hermione and Harry down a circular stone stairway, and Moody emerges as they spot a melancholy figure. Neville reluctantly follows Moody back up the steps. Rain flows like tears down the countenance of a woman in a stained-glass window, and pupils splash across the courtyard with cloaks over their heads to shield themselves from the rain. The chalice of fire stands in the great hall, and qualified pupils cross the ring of illumination around it, placing their names into the azure flame. Cedric Diggory's backers shove him forward, and he steps through the ring to put his name into the chalice, while Ron gives him an encouraging wave. Fred and George dash into the hall in victory, swallow the contents of a test tube, and leap inside the ring to put their names into the chalice but are engulfed in azure flames and flung out of the ring with white hair and lengthy, white beards. They grapple with each other, rolling over on the stone floor. Hermione shakes her head, sits on the stone steps, and opens a book. Accompanied by a Durmstrang pupil and their instructor, Karkaroff, Viktor Krum approaches the ring confidently, with a solemn expression, and puts his name into the chalice, catching Hermione's eye as he turns away. She gives him a faint, admiring smile. The pupils gather excitedly in the great hall as Dumbledore raises his hand, causing the flames of the blazing torches around the hall to gradually die down one by one, and everyone looks expectant. Dumbledore approaches the chalice of fire with his arm outstretched as the azure flame turns crimson, and a piece of charred parchment flutters down into his hand.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The scene starts with a spider that is landed on a desk and then lands on a boy's head before it is crawled up a girl's arm. A wand is flicked by Moody, making the spider hover over Ron, and then it is dropped into Ron's hair. The spider is clamped on Draco's face and is hit against the glass. Moody controls the spider with his wand, and it is made to hover helplessly over a bucket of water before Moody directs it to his palm. Up goes Neville's hand, and he steps towards the table as the spider is writhing in agony. Neville's distraught look, with his face twisted in anger, is noticed. A cry is let out by Hermione, and the wand is lowered by Moody, withdrawing the curse. Neville's eyes are tightly shut, and his face is made clammy. The spider is placed in front of Hermione by Moody, who shakes her head. A flash of green light is emitted, and the spider is killed. Moody's mad eye swivels to stare at Harry, who is looked up at warily by him. Moody nervously licks his lips and is taking a swig from his hip flask, while thoughtful is how Harry regards him. The classroom is left by Ron, following Hermione and Harry down a circular stone staircase, and they spot a sad figure as Moody appears. The stairs are reluctantly followed back up by Neville, behind Moody. Like tears, rain runs down the face of a woman in a stained-glass window, and across the courtyard, the students splash with cloaks over their heads to protect themselves from the rain. In the great hall stands the goblet of fire, and towards it, eligible students cross the circle of light, placing their names into the blue flame. Cedric Diggory is pushed forward by his supporters, and he steps through the circle to put his name into the goblet, while an encouraging wave is given by Ron. Into the hall run Fred and George in triumph, swallowing the contents of a test tube, and jump inside the circle to put their names into the goblet but are engulfed in blue flames and flung out of the circle with white hair and long, white beards. With each other, they grapple, rolling over on the stone floor. Her head is shaken by Hermione, who sits on the stone steps, and a book is opened by her. Approaching the circle confidently, Viktor Krum, accompanied by a Durmstrang student and their teacher, Karkaroff, puts his name into the goblet, catching Hermione's eye as he turns away. An admiring smile, faint, is given by her. Excitedly, the students assemble in the great hall as flames of the burning torches around the hall are gradually caused to die down one by one by Dumbledore raising his hand, and everyone looks expectant. Approaching the goblet of fire with his arm outstretched, Dumbledore causes the blue flame to turn red, and a piece of charred parchment is flutters down into his hand.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The scene begins with a spider landing on a desk, then on a boy's head, and crawling up a girl's arm. Moody uses his wand to make the spider hover over Ron, dropping it into Ron's hair. The spider latches onto Draco's face and hits the glass. Moody's wand controls the spider, making it hover over water before directing it to his hand. Neville steps forward as the spider writhes in pain. Looking distraught, Neville's face shows anger. Hermione cries out, prompting Moody to release the curse. Neville's eyes are shut, and his face is clammy. Moody places the spider before Hermione, who shakes her head. A green light flashes, and the spider dies. Moody's eye swivels to Harry, who looks up warily. Moody nervously licks his lips and drinks from his hip flask, while Harry watches thoughtfully. Leaving the classroom, Ron follows Hermione and Harry down a circular staircase, spotting a sad figure as Neville reluctantly follows Moody. Rain runs down the face of a stained-glass woman, and students hurry across the courtyard with cloaks shielding them from the rain. The goblet of fire stands in the great hall, and students cross its lit circle to place their names in the blue flame. Cedric Diggory's supporters push him forward, and he submits his name with Ron waving encouragingly. Fred and George triumphantly enter, drink from a test tube, and attempt to put their names in the goblet but are engulfed and thrown out with white hair and beards. They wrestle on the stone floor. Hermione shakes her head, sits on steps, and opens a book. Viktor Krum, accompanied by Karkaroff and a Durmstrang student, confidently approaches the circle, submits his name, and catches Hermione's eye, receiving her faint, admiring smile. Students gather in anticipation as Dumbledore raises his hand, dimming the torch flames in the hall. He approaches the goblet as the blue flame turns red, and a charred parchment flutters down into his hand.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A spider lands on a desk, then on a boy's head, and crawls up a girl's arm. Moody uses his wand to hover the spider over Ron, dropping it into his hair. It clamps on Draco's face, hits glass, and hovers over water before Moody directs it to his hand. Neville, distressed, steps forward as the spider writhes in pain. Hermione cries out, Moody lifts the curse, and places the spider before her. A green flash kills it. Moody's eye fixes on Harry, nervously drinking from his flask. Leaving class, Ron, Hermione, and Harry go down a staircase, followed by a sad Neville. Rain streams down a window, students dash across the courtyard with cloaks. In the great hall, students submit names to the goblet of fire. Cedric Diggory enters the circle with Ron's support. Fred and George enter triumphantly, take a potion, and are thrown out with altered appearances. They wrestle on the floor. Hermione, sitting on steps, reads. Viktor Krum confidently submits his name, catching Hermione's admiring glance. In the excited great hall, Dumbledore dims the torches, approaches the goblet, and catches a falling charred parchment as the flame turns red.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The unfolding scene begins with a small spider that suddenly makes its entrance by landing on a desk. It then makes its way onto a boy's head before daringly crawling up a girl's arm. With a flick of his wand, the ever-watchful Moody causes the spider to levitate and hover ominously over Ron, and it soon falls into Ron’s hair, much to his dismay. The spider, not yet finished with its chaotic journey, clings to Draco's face before audaciously hitting a nearby glass. Under the spell of Moody’s wand, the spider hovers helplessly over a bucket filled with water, only to be directed into the palm of Moody’s hand. Meanwhile, Neville raises his hand defiantly and takes a step toward the table, his eyes fixed on the writhing spider in clear distress. Neville’s expression is one of deep turmoil, his face twisted with anger and dismay. As Hermione lets out a cry of distress, Moody lowers his wand and withdraws the curse, bringing the spider's suffering to an end. Neville’s eyes remain tightly shut, his face pale and clammy with anxiety. Moody places the now lifeless spider in front of Hermione, who shakes her head in refusal. A bright flash of green light suddenly bursts forth, and the spider meets its untimely demise. Moody's wildly swiveling mad eye targets Harry with an intense stare, and Harry looks up cautiously. Moody, appearing nervous, licks his lips anxiously and takes a quick swig from his trusty hip flask, while Harry observes him with a thoughtful expression. As the class comes to an end, Ron follows Hermione and Harry as they make their way down a winding stone staircase. Moody, keeping a watchful eye, appears as the trio notices a somber figure among them. Neville, albeit reluctantly, follows Moody back up the stairs, his steps slow and hesitant. Outside, rain cascades like tears down the face of a sad woman depicted in a stained-glass window. Students rush across the courtyard, their cloaks pulled over their heads to shield themselves from the relentless rain. Within the great hall stands the goblet of fire, radiating an air of mystique and importance. Eligible students eagerly cross the circle of light surrounding the goblet, each one placing their names into the mystical blue flame. Cedric Diggory’s supporters propel him forward, and he bravely steps through the circle, putting his name into the goblet as Ron gives him an encouraging wave of approval. With a flourish, Fred and George burst into the hall, triumphantly swallowing the contents of a mysterious test tube before leaping into the circle to submit their names. However, they are met with a formidable force as the blue flames engulf them, tossing them out of the circle with faces adorned by white hair and long, snowy beards. The two brothers grapple with one another, rolling over the cold stone floor in a comical struggle. Hermione looks on and shakes her head, then sits on the stone steps and opens a book to immerse herself in its pages. Accompanied by a student from Durmstrang and their teacher, the formidable Karkaroff, Viktor Krum strides confidently toward the circle, his expression serious and focused. He places his name into the goblet, catching Hermione’s eye as he turns away, prompting a faint yet admiring smile from her. The gathering students sway with excitement in the great hall as Dumbledore raises his hand, causing the flames of the burning torches positioned around the hall to gradually die down one after the other, creating a hushed atmosphere filled with anticipation. Dumbledore strides toward the goblet of fire with his arm confidently outstretched, as the once-blue flame transforms into a fiery red. A charred piece of parchment gracefully flutters down into his waiting hand, much to the assembly's expectancy.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The unfolding scene begins with the sudden arrival of a small spider, which unexpectedly makes its entrance by landing on a desk. From this initial spot, it proceeds to embark on its journey by making its way onto a boy's head, before boldly and daringly crawling up a girl's arm. Watching with keen vigilance, the ever-watchful Moody, with a flick of his wand, causes the spider to levitate and ominously hover over Ron. Not long after, it falls directly into Ron’s hair, much to his visible dismay and discomfort. The spider, not yet concluding its chaotic journey, latches onto Draco's face before audaciously colliding with a nearby glass with a soft thud. Under the influence of Moody’s spell, the spider hovers helplessly above a bucket filled with water, and is then directed into the palm of Moody’s hand with precision. Meanwhile, Neville raises his hand defiantly, taking a determined step toward the table, his intense gaze fixed on the writhing spider in its clear distress. His expression reveals a deep-seated turmoil, his features twisted with a mixture of anger and dismay. As Hermione emits a cry of distress, Moody intervenes by lowering his wand, withdrawing the curse, and thereby putting an end to the spider's suffering. Throughout this, Neville’s eyes remain tightly shut, his face growing pale and clammy due to his anxiety. Moody, with an air of finality, places the now lifeless spider in front of Hermione, who responds by shaking her head in refusal. Suddenly, a bright flash of green light pierces the scene, and the spider meets its untimely demise. With an intense stare, Moody's wildly swiveling mad eye targets Harry, and Harry looks up cautiously in response. Appearing nervous, Moody anxiously licks his lips and takes a quick swig from his trusty hip flask, while Harry observes him thoughtfully. As the class comes to its conclusion, Ron follows Hermione and Harry as they make their way down a winding stone staircase. Moody, maintaining his vigilant watch, appears as the trio becomes aware of a somber figure moving among them. Neville, although reluctant in his demeanor, follows Moody back up the stairs with slow and hesitant steps. Outside, the rain cascades down like tears on the face of a sorrowful woman depicted in a stained-glass window. Students rush across the courtyard, their cloaks pulled snugly over their heads to shield themselves from the relentless, pouring rain. Within the great hall, the goblet of fire stands with an aura of mystique and significance. Eager eligible students cross the circle of light surrounding the goblet, each one placing their names into its mystical blue flame. Cedric Diggory’s supporters eagerly propel him forward, and with a brave step, he enters the circle, placing his name into the goblet as Ron gives him an encouraging wave of approval. With a flamboyant flourish, Fred and George burst into the hall, triumphantly swallowing the contents of a mysterious test tube before leaping into the circle to submit their names. However, they are met with a formidable force as the blue flames dramatically engulf them, tossing them out of the circle with their faces now adorned by white hair and long, snowy beards. The two brothers, in a comical struggle, grapple with each other, rolling over the cold stone floor. Hermione observes and shakes her head in mild disapproval, then sits down on the stone steps, opening a book to immerse herself deeply within its pages. Accompanied by a student from Durmstrang and their teacher, the formidable Karkaroff, Viktor Krum strides toward the circle with an air of confidence, his expression serious and focused. As he places his name into the goblet, he catches Hermione’s eye, prompting a faint yet admiring smile to appear on her face. The gathering students sway with excitement within the great hall as Dumbledore raises his hand, causing the flames of the burning torches surrounding the hall to gradually die down one after another, creating an atmosphere filled with hushed anticipation. Dumbledore strides confidently toward the goblet of fire, his arm outstretched, as the once-blue flame transforms into a fiery red hue. A charred piece of parchment gracefully flutters down into his waiting hand, much to the assembly's expectancy and excitement.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The scene commences with a spider that makes its sudden descent onto a desk, swiftly transitioning to landing on a boy's head, before beginning its journey crawling up a girl's arm. As this unfolds, Moody, with a flick of his wand, causes the spider to hover precariously over Ron. In a swift motion, the spider drops into Ron's hair, causing it to clamp itself onto Draco's face and smack against the glass. Under Moody’s control, with each precise movement of his wand, the spider finds itself hovering helplessly above a waiting bucket of water, only to be redirected towards the palm of Moody's hand. Observing this, Neville raises his hand and cautiously steps toward the table, visibly distressed by the sight of the spider writhing in agony. Neville's face twists in anger, reflecting his inner turmoil. Meanwhile, Hermione’s voice rings out in protest, and Moody responds by lowering his wand, thus releasing the curse. With Neville's eyes tightly shut, his face grows clammy with the stress of the situation. Moody then decisively places the spider in front of Hermione, who responds by shaking her head in refusal. In an instant, a flash of green light fills the room, culminating in the spider's demise. As the tension lingers, Moody's mad eye fixates intently on Harry, who cautiously lifts his gaze upwards, meeting Moody’s stare with wary acknowledgment. In a nervous gesture, Moody licks his lips and takes a quick swig from his hip flask, while Harry continues to study him thoughtfully. Departing the classroom, Ron trails behind Hermione and Harry as they descend a circular stone staircase, with Moody appearing just as they notice a forlorn figure. Neville, with a sense of reluctance, follows Moody back up the stairs. Outside, rain cascades like tears down the visage of a woman depicted in a stained-glass window, while students dart across the courtyard, shielding themselves with cloaks to ward off the rain. Inside the great hall stands the goblet of fire, surrounded by eager eligible students who step forward into the circle of light to submit their names into the flickering blue flame. Among them, Cedric Diggory, buoyed by his supporters, is gently pushed forward; he confidently steps within the circle to add his name to the goblet, while Ron acknowledges him with an encouraging wave. In a burst of excitement, Fred and George sprint into the hall triumphantly, ingest the contents of a test tube, and leap into the circle to cast their names into the goblet. Yet, they are immediately ensnared by blue flames and hurled out of the circle, emerging with comically altered appearances—white hair and elongated white beards. The twins grapple playfully with each other, rolling around on the cold stone floor. Nearby, Hermione, displaying mild disapproval, shakes her head before sitting on the stone steps, where she opens a book to read. Meanwhile, accompanied by a Durmstrang student and their teacher Karkaroff, Viktor Krum strides confidently toward the circle with a serious demeanor, places his name into the goblet, and momentarily catches Hermione’s eye as he turns away; she responds with a subtle, admiring smile. Anticipation hangs in the air as students gather excitedly in the great hall, their attention drawn to Dumbledore, who raises his hand, prompting the flames of the torches around the hall to gradually diminish one by one, heightening the sense of expectation. Approaching the goblet of fire with a steady outstretched arm, Dumbledore witnesses the blue flame turn a striking red, as a charred piece of parchment slowly flutters down into his waiting hand, marking a pivotal moment.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The scene begins with a spider landing on a desk, then moving to a boy's head before crawling up a girl's arm. Moody uses his wand to hover the spider over Ron, causing it to drop into Ron's hair before it clamps onto Draco's face and hits the glass. He then controls the spider to hover over a bucket of water before directing it to his palm. As Neville, looking distraught, steps forward, Hermione cries out, prompting Moody to lower his wand and lift the curse. Moody places the spider in front of Hermione; a flash of green light kills it. His mad eye swivels to Harry, who warily meets his gaze as Moody nervously takes a drink from his flask. Outside the classroom, Ron, Hermione, and Harry descend a staircase, spotting a sad figure as Moody and Neville ascend. Rain streaks a stained-glass window like tears as students hurriedly cross the courtyard, cloaks shielding them from the rain. In the great hall, students eagerly cross a circle of light to submit their names to the goblet of fire. Cedric Diggory steps forward with encouragement from Ron, while Fred and George, after drinking from test tubes, attempt the same but are humorously rejected by the goblet's blue flames. Hermione, shaking her head, sits with a book. Viktor Krum, flanked by a Durmstrang student and Karkaroff, confidently submits his name, sharing a fleeting smile with Hermione. As students gather in anticipation, Dumbledore raises his hand to dim the hall's torches. He approaches the goblet as its blue flame turns red, and a charred parchment flutters into his hand.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The scene starts with a spider that lands on a desk and then on a boy's head before crawling up a girl's arm, perhaps a nod to the mischievous nature of magical creatures at Hogwarts. Moody, a former Auror known for his intense vigilance against dark magic, flicks his wand, making the spider hover over Ron, and then it drops into Ron's hair. The spider clamps itself on Draco's face and hits the glass, a likely reminder of the enchanted classroom's peculiarities. Controlled by Moody's wand, the spider hovers helplessly over a bucket of water before Moody directs it to the palm of his hand. Neville, often anxious in Defense Against the Dark Arts classes due to his family's history, puts up his hand and steps towards the table as the spider writhes in agony. Neville looks distraught, with his face twisted in anger. Hermione cries out, and Moody lowers his wand, withdrawing the curse that is unsettling for those nearby. Neville's eyes are tight shut, and his face is clammy from the tense situation. Moody places the spider in front of Hermione, who shakes her head, likely due to her aversion to the use of curses. A flash of green light occurs, reminiscent of the Killing Curse, and the spider dies. Moody's mad eye, a notorious magical enhancement, swivels to stare at Harry, who looks up warily. Moody nervously licks his lips and takes a swig from his hip flask, while Harry regards him thoughtfully, aware of the flask's mysterious content. Leaving the classroom, Ron follows Hermione and Harry down a circular stone staircase, architecturally unique to the castle, and Moody appears as they spot a sad figure. Neville reluctantly follows Moody back up the stairs, indicating his complex feelings about his magical education. Rain runs like tears down the face of a woman in a stained-glass window, a hallmark of the castle's historical decor, and students splash across the courtyard with cloaks over their heads to protect themselves from the rain. The goblet of fire stands in the great hall, a symbol of the Triwizard Tournament, and eligible students cross the circle of light around it, placing their names into the blue flame. Cedric Diggory's supporters push him forward, and he steps through the circle to put his name into the goblet, while Ron gives him an encouraging wave, showing camaraderie among competing houses. Fred and George, known for their pranks, run into the hall in triumph, swallow the contents of a test tube, and jump inside the circle to put their names into the goblet but are engulfed in blue flames and flung out of the circle with white hair and long, white beards, victims of their playful experimentation. They grapple with each other, rolling over on the stone floor as others laugh. Hermione shakes her head at their antics, sits on the stone steps, and opens a book, seeking solace in her study. Accompanied by a Durmstrang student and their stern teacher, Karkaroff, Viktor Krum, a renowned Quidditch player, approaches the circle confidently, with a serious look, and puts his name into the goblet, catching Hermione's eye as he turns away. She gives him a faint, admiring smile, impressed by his confidence. The students assemble excitedly in the great hall as Dumbledore, Hogwarts' revered headmaster, raises his hand, causing the flames of the burning torches around the hall to gradually die down one by one, and everyone looks expectant. Dumbledore approaches the goblet of fire with his arm outstretched as the blue flame turns red, and a piece of charred parchment flutters down into his hand, signaling the beginning of the tournament.

test_cases.description: The scene starts with a spider that lands on a desk and then on a boy's head before crawling up a girl's arm. Moody flicks his wand making the spider hover over Ron and then it drops into Ron's hair. The spider clamps itself on Draco's face and hits the glass. Neville puts up his hand and steps towards the table as the spider writhes in agony. Neville looks distraught with his face twisted in anger. Hermione cries out and Moody lowers his wand withdrawing the curse. Neville's eyes are tight shut and his face is clammy. Moody places the spider in front of Hermione who shakes her head. A flash of green light occurs and the spider dies. Moody's mad eye swivels to stare at Harry who looks up warily. Moody nervously licks his lips and takes a swig from his hip flask while Harry regards him thoughtfully. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. Leaving the classroom Ron follows Hermione and Harry down a circular stone staircase and Moody appears as they spot a sad figure. Neville reluctantly follows Moody back up the stairs. Rain runs like tears down the face of a woman in a stainedglass window and students splash across the courtyard with cloaks over their heads to protect themselves from the rain. The goblet of fire stands in the great hall and eligible students cross the circle of light around it placing their names into the blue flame. Cedric Diggory's supporters push him forward and he steps through the circle to put his name into the goblet while Ron gives him an encouraging wave. Fred and George run into the hall in triumph swallow the contents of a test tube and jump inside the circle to put their names into the goblet but are engulfed in blue flames and flung out of the circle with white hair and long white beards. They grapple with each other rolling over on the stone floor. Hermione shakes her head sits on the stone steps and opens a book. Accompanied by a Durmstrang student and their teacher Karkaroff. Viktor Krum approaches the circle confidently with a serious look and puts his name into the goblet catching Hermione's eye as he turns away. She gives him a faint admiring smile. The students assemble excitedly in the great hall as Dumbledore raises his hand causing the flames of the burning torches around the hall to gradually die down one by one and everyone looks expectant. Dumbledore approaches the goblet of fire with his arm outstretched as the blue flame turns red and a piece of charred parchment flutters down into his hand.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The scene starts with a spider that lands on a desk and then on a boy's head before crawling up a girl's arm. Moody flicks his wand making the spider hover over Ron and then it drops into Ron's hair. The spider clamps itself on Draco's face and hits the glass. Controlled by Moody's wand the spider hovers helplessly over a bucket of water before Moody directs it to the palm of his hand. Neville puts up his hand and steps towards the table as the spider writhes in agony. Neville looks distraught with his face twisted in anger. They grapple with each other rolling over on the stone floor. Hermione shakes her head sits on the stone steps and opens a book. Accompanied by a Durmstrang student and their teacher Karkaroff. Viktor Krum approaches the circle confidently with a serious look and puts his name into the goblet catching Hermione's eye as he turns away. She gives him a faint admiring smile. The students assemble excitedly in the great hall as Dumbledore raises his hand causing the flames of the burning torches around the hall to gradually die down one by one and everyone looks expectant. Dumbledore approaches the goblet of fire with his arm outstretched as the blue flame turns red and a piece of charred parchment flutters down into his hand.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: The scene starts with a spider that lands on a desk and then on a boy's head before crawling up a girl's arm. Moody flicks his wand making the spider hover over Ron and then it drops into Ron's hair. She gives him a faint admiring smile. The students assemble excitedly in the great hall as Dumbledore raises his hand causing the flames of the burning torches around the hall to gradually die down one by one and everyone looks expectant. Dumbledore approaches the goblet of fire with his arm outstretched as the blue flame turns red and a piece of charred parchment flutters down into his hand.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The narrative kicks off with a hummingbird that bounces onto a piano and then onto a cat's tail before scooting up a penguin's beak. Teddy snaps his fingers, causing the hummingbird to zoom over Lara, and then it lands in Lara's shoelaces. The hummingbird clamps itself on Fiona's elbow and bumps the mirror. Guided by Teddy's fingers, the hummingbird floats awkwardly over a bowl of cereal before Teddy directs it to the tip of his shoe. Cassidy raises her foot and slides towards the couch as the hummingbird twitches in confusion. Cassidy appears troubled, with her nose scrunched in disappointment. Olivia shouts out, and Teddy lowers his fingers, removing the spell. Cassidy's eyelids are tightly closed, and her forehead is sweaty. Teddy places the hummingbird in front of Olivia, who shakes her shoulders. A flash of orange light appears, and the hummingbird vanishes. Teddy's wild nose swivels to gaze at Ken, who glances up cautiously. Teddy quietly chews his fingernails and takes a sip from his thermos, while Ken observes him curiously. Exiting the library, Lara follows Olivia and Ken down a winding marble escalator, and Teddy shows up as they notice a joyful creature. Cassidy reluctantly follows Teddy back down the escalator. Wind howls like music through the ears of a man in a wooden-frame painting, and professors wade across the balcony with hats over their legs to shield them from the wind. The candlestick of wax stands in the vast kitchen, and eager professors stride through the haze of darkness surrounding it, dropping their letters into the violet mist. Calvin Candle's allies nudge him backward, and he hops beyond the fog to toss his letter into the candlestick, while Lara gives him an inviting bounce. Tim and Tom glide into the kitchen in joy, drink the contents of a coffee mug, and leap outside the fog to toss their letters into the candlestick but are engulfed in violet mist and hurled from the fog with green feathers and fluffy, green scarves. They wrestle with each other, tumbling over on the wooden plank. Olivia shakes her feet, perches on the wooden bench, and closes a scroll. Accompanied by a Luchland researcher and their mentor, Kalagor, Viktor Ram strolls to the fog confidently, with a jubilant grin, and drops his letter into the candlestick, catching Olivia's ear as he saunters away. She gives him a broad, admiring frown. The professors gather noisily in the vast kitchen as Donny raises his toe, causing the crackles of the blazing flames around the kitchen to gradually burst in one by one, and everyone seems sluggish. Donny heads to the candlestick of wax with his foot extended as the violet mist turns orange, and a strip of torn fabric spirals up into his pocket.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The scene begins with a spider landing on a desk, a boy's head, and a girl's arm before Moody uses his wand to make it hover and eventually drop onto Ron's hair. It attaches to Draco's face, hitting the glass, then hovers over water before Moody directs it to his hand. Neville approaches the table as the spider suffers, looking distraught. Hermione cries out, prompting Moody to lift the curse. After a flash of green light, the spider dies. Moody's eye swivels to Harry, who watches cautiously. Moody nervously drinks from his hip flask. As Ron follows Hermione and Harry out, Moody leads a reluctant Neville back. In a rainy courtyard, students hurry with cloaks over their heads. In the great hall, students place their names in the Goblet of Fire. Cedric Diggory enters the circle confidently, encouraged by Ron. Fred and George, after drinking from a test tube, are flung out with white hair when they try. Hermione shakes her head and reads a book. Viktor Krum puts his name in the goblet, catching Hermione’s admiring glance. As Dumbledore raises his hand, the torch flames dim, and he retrieves a charred parchment from the goblet.
